text: written.- I voted in favor of this motion for a resolution, because I fully share the spirit of non-discrimination against social groups such as deaf people, and we defend the principle of equality in institutions.The Resolution has been firmly defended and worked on by our parliamentary group, and defends the full integration of this group, facilitating the accessibility of all information, and requesting European recognition of professional sign language interpreters.

name: Viktor USPASKICH
text: in writing.- I am aware of the importance of fair and accurate interpretation and translation services, especially in court and in other legal settings;I therefore reiterate the important role of highly qualified professional sign language interpreters, especially in this environment.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the motion for a resolution to wind up the debate on the statement by the Commission pursuant to Rule 123(2) of the Rules of Procedure on sign languages and professional sign language interpreters. As full citizens, all persons with disabilities, in particular women and children, are entitled to inalienable dignity, equal treatment, independent living, autonomy and full participation in society. There are approximately one million deaf sign language users in the EU and 51 million hard-of-hearing citizens, many of whom are also sign language users. The report recognises that sign language interpretation constitutes a professional service requiring appropriate remuneration. It equally stresses the need for qualified and professional sign language interpreters. I voted in favour because I believe that deaf, deafblind and hard-of-hearing citizens must have access to the same information and communication as their peers.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: written.- This text highlights the crucial importance of the recognition of sign language and the availability of interpretation for the full inclusion of deaf people in society.It further stresses that mere recognition is not enough, but that only full implementation of the legislation in the Member States can ensure that deaf Europeans have access to fully qualified interpreters with recognized university qualifications.And it is that, according to it, there is generally a serious lack of fully qualified sign language interpreters in the Community territory.Based on the desire to improve the quality of life of the million people with hearing disabilities in Spain, as well as the group of people who suffer from it throughout Europe, I have supported this document with my vote.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: written. - I voted in favor of this resolution since it is committed to the effective defense of the rights of deaf, deaf-blind or hard of hearing people and calls for a series of measures such as the official recognition of sign languages, both national and regional , in the different Member States as well as in the EU institutions. In addition, it advocates for the professional recognition of sign language interpreters and advocates the incorporation of sign language into educational programs in a similar way to foreign languages. Likewise, it considers that the inclusion of deaf, deaf-blind or hearing-impaired people must be guaranteed in European programs such as Erasmus +, and their labor integration must be effectively promoted in the European institutions. Aware of the importance of promoting sign language at an educational level to sensitize society as a whole and facilitate respect for the right to equality of the more than 52 million citizens and residents who are estimated to speak in different languages ​​of signs in the EU, I have decided to support this text.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: written.- I voted in favor, because accessibility for people with disabilities is a precondition for an independent life and full and equal participation in community life.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing.- This resolution comes a few days after the National Day of the Portuguese Sign Language, an ephemeris that should be valued, with respect for the inclusion of its users.Corresponds to the need to provide technical support to deaf students, including interpretation (so that it is not paid for by families), and to help companies with resources to include deaf people (who exclude, for example, a deaf person from a job interview) and streamlineservices that promote an inclusive policy (availability of interpreters).In the specific case of this resolution, it is considered that the eminently technical character it presents highlights the needs of deaf people.Many of the issues that are part of our proposals for this area are included, so the resolution can be supported.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: written.- I voted in favor of the motion for a resolution on sign language and professional sign language interpreters, because I believe that accessibility is important for people with disabilities so that they can lead an independent life without any restrictions.

name: Julie WARD
text: in writing. ‒ As a disability rights champion and as a qualified BSL signer, I welcome EU action to promote sign language learning. The EU must promote a non-discriminatory approach to the use of a sign language, as required under the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, which has been ratified by the EU and all EU Member States except one.

name: Anna ZÁBORSKÁ
text: in writing - The Resolution on Sign Language and Professional Sign Language Interpreters addresses the issue of discrimination on the grounds of disability.I agree with this resolution, as people with disabilities have a full right to human dignity and full participation in social life.This report addresses the need for the recognition of sign language as an official language in the Member States and the EU institutions and the availability of qualified and professional interpreters of that language.It is important that people with hearing impairments have secure access to public administration information and services.I also welcome the initiative to include sign language in the curriculum in order to raise awareness of this language.It is true that society defines precisely how it treats the most vulnerable.

name: Auke ZIJLSTRA
text: written. - The PVV voted against the motion sign language and professional sign interpreters. The motion requires, among other things, that: sign interpreters should be available in government institutions and in education, sign language should be part of the curriculum, European institutions, including the European Parliament, should hire more deaf people. The PVV is of the opinion that in the Netherlands the participation of people with a physical disability in society is guaranteed. The Netherlands is far ahead of the proposals made in the European Parliament. The proposals also go beyond the mandate of the EP. The obligation by the European Union to include sign language in curricula cannot support the PVV, as the EP has no say over the curricula in education. The PVV applauds the fact that the EU advocates improving support for the deaf and hard of hearing for its own institutions. However, this motion is not necessary for that, one can simply do that.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: in writing - I of course supported the resolution on sign language and professional sign language interpreters and I am also one of its co-sponsors. The main objective of this resolution is to achieve the recognition of sign languages ​​as the official languages ​​of the Member States and the European institutions. Although many people do not realize this, sign languages ​​are key means of communication for the approximately one million deaf people of the European Union. Nevertheless, interpretation into these languages ​​is rarely provided, and interpreters (including in public institutions) are often replaced by deaf family members. In addition, education in this area lags far behind. I therefore think that the recognition of sign language is an absolutely natural requirement, which follows, among other things, from the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. And the European Parliament should set a positive example and formally introduce sign language interpretation.

name: Željana ZOVKO
text: written.- I support the motion for a resolution on sign language and professional sign language translators.In ensuring equal access for people with disabilities to various services and facilities, it is important to provide integration mechanisms for people with hearing impairments and deaf people.The ability to communicate and communicate is a key prerequisite for successful involvement in the community, workplace, study, and access to services and facilities.Member States' action on this area is diverse, practices are uneven and inconsistent.With this motion for a resolution, the European Union recognizes this problem and calls for it to be addressed as soon as possible.

name: Milan ZVER
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the European Parliament resolution on sign languages and professional sign language interpreters.Deaf, deafblind and hard of hearing citizens must have access to the same information and communication as hearing people - through sign language interpretation, subtitling, automatic speech recording and / or other forms of communication, including speech interpreters.In this way, we enable them to live independently, independently and to participate fully in society.I therefore support the text of the Resolution, which proposes measures to ensure high-quality sign language interpretation services.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing.- This report addresses the issues relating to the use in agriculture, as a selective post-emergence herbicide, of the active substance bentazone, which has been found to have a high potential for direct leaching into groundwater.Considering that the assessment of the uses of bentazone is insufficient to conclude that there will be no harmful effects on human or animal health or on groundwater or any unacceptable impact on the environment, the Commission is requested to withdraw the draft implementing regulation,which provided for the authorization of the bentazone until January 31, 2032, and to present a new project.I voted in favor.

name: Clara AGUILERA
text: written.- I voted against this objection because, when it occurs that an active substance fulfills the requirements for authorization, including the EFSA scientific report, I consider that the EC has acted correctly, especially since it remainsopen the possibility of providing new data that can confirm or interrupt said authorization.Farmers need active substances to fight pests.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: written.- I voted in favor of this objection, because I am against the renewal of the active substance bentazone, one of the pesticides most frequently found in underground and deep waters, since there is no scientific data to show that it is aSafe substance, neither for human and animal health nor for the environment.Therefore, the Commission proposal goes against the precautionary principle and ignores the Ombudsman's proposals to improve the Commission's pesticide approval system (restricting the practice of approving a substance while simultaneously requesting data that is expected toconfirm your security), so I voted in favor of the objection.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. – We voted in favour of this objection to the Commission proposal to renew approval for the active substance bentazone, a broad-use herbicide. The Commission is proposing to approve bentazone for the maximum time limit of 15 years even though the data available has substantial gaps and whilst it is also a substance which can easily leak into ground water and is suspected of interfering with human reproduction. No active substance should be approved for safe use without the essential data which proves its safety. The European Commission must request and assess the relevant missing information before deciding to renew the authorisation.   The European Ombudsman earlier this year called on the Commission to severely restrict the use of this process, known as the confirmatory data procedure. The Commission however has ignored this recommendation and infringed the precautionary principle by proposing the approval of bentazone. For these reasons, I voted against its reauthorisation and called on the Commission to withdraw its proposal and submit a new one.

name: Eric ANDRIEU
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this objection.The Commission should take into account all the data necessary to confirm the safety of a given substance before granting authorizations.The approval period must be proportionate to the possible risks inherent in the use of these substances.The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle of the authorization process for all plant protection products.

name: Laima Liucija ANDRIKIENĖ
text: in writing.- I voted against the resolution on the renewal of the authorization of the active substance benzaton because the assessment of the representative use of the active substance benzaton was insufficient to conclude that a plant protection product containing the active substance will not adversely affect human or animal health or groundwater.As there is still not enough information on the harmlessness of benzathone, I cannot agree with my colleague Pavel Poc's amendment calling on the Commission to approve benzaton by 2024.July 31, vol.y.7.5 years.There are already a lot of harmful substances in our environment, so we cannot look at the use of another harmful substance casually.Since the Pavel Poc amendment was nevertheless adopted, I had to vote against the resolution in its entirety.I hope that the Commission will receive the missing information and assess it thoroughly before adopting the decision.

name: Pascal ARIMONT
text: written.- The European Commission has submitted a draft decision to the member states according to which the authorization of the controversial substance bentazone, which is used in plant protection products, is to be extended until 2032.In its objection, the EU Parliament declares the submission of this draft inadmissible because the effects and risks of the active substance have not yet been sufficiently clarified and the Commission is therefore exceeding its powers with the authorization draft.Parliament considered that the bentazone risk analysis had significant shortcomings that needed to be addressed and asked the Commission to submit a different draft to the Member States.I voted in favor of Parliament's objection because I am convinced that consumer protection must be the most important criterion in the authorization process and that the precautionary principle should apply here without restriction.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: in writing. - This text consists of an objection by the ENVI committee to the renewal of the active substance bentazon. Bentazon is a commonly used pesticide, especially in peas, beans and potatoes. Doubts remain about its harmfulness to humans and the environment, despite several encouraging studies. In particular, bentazon can infiltrate surface and groundwater. In addition, doubts remain as to the dangerousness of bentazon for human health, although, according to the conclusions of several scientific studies emanating in particular from the World Health Organization, this would be conditioned on the absorption of very strong doses of bentazon. In view of the importance of this information, the so-called “confirmation data” procedure goes against the precautionary principle, and cannot be the basis for granting an authorization for a period of fifteen years (the maximum period ). For all these reasons, the ENF group supports the objection calling on the Commission to carry out the additional assessments necessary for the renewal of the authorization of bentazone, before proceeding with it. I therefore voted in favor of this objection.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this resolution because Bentazone is a much-needed herbicide within the agricultural industry and is currently approved for use in the UK. With every herbicide we ban across the EU, we put more farmers out of work and rely more heavily on unrestricted imported goods. This leads to the potential of worsening environmental standards globally - in essence, outsourcing environmental damage.

name: Jean ARTHUIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this objection not to renew the authorization to import and market the active substance bentazon.Its use could have harmful effects on users and consumers.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the motion for a resolution on the objection pursuant to Rule 106 of the Rules of Procedure: renewal of the authorization of the active substance benzonate.2016April 8Commission Implementing Regulation, the approval of the active substance bentazone was extended until 2017.30 June due to the postponement of the evaluation of the substance.However, after considering the comments received on the extension assessment report, it was decided that EFSA should carry out expert advice and issue conclusions as to whether the active substance bentazone could be expected to comply with the conditions laid down in the Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council.Based on the findings of the EFSA, the assessment of the representative use of the active substance bentazone was found to be insufficient.I therefore agree that the Commission infringed the provisions of the Regulation and the precautionary principle by applying the active substance bentazone.

name: Zoltán BALCZÓ
text: in writing. - The purpose of this motion for a resolution is for the Commission to withdraw the extension of the EU marketing authorization for herbicides containing or containing bentazone for a maximum period. Bentazone is a selective herbicide applied 1-15 days after the emergence of crops that kills broadleaf weeds. In the UK, a number of studies have been published on bentazone showing in detail that bentazone can be enriched in groundwater and, due to its higher concentration, can inhibit not only soil and crop production, but also fauna and, in particular, mammalian reproduction. Indirectly, this is a compound that is also harmful to human health, especially in the knowledge that bentazone herbicides are the most widely used and widely used herbicides in the EU. It is important to mention this when refusing permission. that EFSA had once again demonstrated in its scientific assessment that it had carried out a highly questionable and superficial scientific assessment in a professional manner, disregarding toxicity to small mammals and examining it in the context of a scientific consultation. As the motion calls for the repeal of the Commission's marketing authorization regulation, I supported it.

name: Gerard BATTEN
text: in writing. ‒ Today UKIP voted against the non-legislative resolution on renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone. We believe it is important to assess missing safety information on the use of this substance. However, we would like this issue to be decided by national Parliaments.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: in writing.- Bentazon is a pesticide whose harmfulness to humans and the environment is still debated.The UK Environment Agency has found frequent cases of bentazon contamination of water, ground and surface, as pesticides tend to leach into soils.This objection to the re-authorization of the active substance bentazon rightly underlines that the tests and studies are far from unanimous on the absence of dangers and that is why I voted in favor of it.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: in writing.- I approved this resolution which rejects the draft Commission regulation renewing the approval of the active substance bentazon.The report considers that the evaluation of the representative uses of the substance bentazon is not sufficient to conclude that it could not have a harmful effect on human health.It therefore calls on the Commission to prioritize the assessment of relevant missing information before taking a decision on the approval.

name: Beatriz BECERRA BASTERRECHEA
text: written.- I have voted against this report for various reasons.Firstly, because the Commission's draft Implementing Regulation does not implement the proposals of the European Ombudsman for a solution to improve the Commission's pesticide approval system.But above all, I see no logic in the Commission's decision to approve an active substance, while requesting data confirming its safety (a process known as the 'confirmatory data procedure') would allow the active substance to be placed on the market before the Commissionwould have obtained all the necessary data to support that decision.We must therefore wait to have this data before making any decision in this regard.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: written.- I vote in favor of the objection in line with the precautionary principle to avoid the renewal of the bentazone.In the absence of data demonstrating the safety of a chemical substance, I understand that its use should not be authorized.The European Commission exceeds its enforcement powers provided for in Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009.The planned reauthorization of bentazone for 15 years is not compatible with the purpose of Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009, which is to ensure a high level of protection for both human and animal health and the environment.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: written.- I want to thank Mr Poc for his work on this report, which I voted against.I have also voted in favor of the PPE amendment where the authorization of said product was requested until July 31, 2024. As this amendment was not approved, I have voted against the report that I consider that the Commission exceeds the powers ofexecution provided for in Regulation (EC) no.1107/2009.The agricultural sector needs this product for its crops and EFSA has already said that it is not harmful and has well covered safety standards.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: in writing.- I wanted to support this objection from the Parliament's ENVI committee concerning the renewal of the authorization of bentazon.I consider that the lack of reliable data on the potential dangers that this substance could pose to human health does not allow an immediate renewal.All the more so after the publication of the UK Environment Agency study, which found frequent cases of bentazon contamination of groundwater and even surface water.Certainly, I am aware of the conclusions issued by the WHO in several of its reports and which assures that the risks are conditioned by a strong abstention from bentazone.Prevention is better than cure, however, and that is why many evaluations of the effects of this pesticide need to be carried out.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing.- I supported with my vote the objection to the renewal of the authorization of the active substance bentazone.

name: Malin BJÖRK
text: in writing. – I voted in favour of this objection to the Commission proposal to renew approval for the active substance bentazone, a broad-use herbicide. The Commission is proposing to approve bentazone for the maximum time limit of 15 years even though the data available has substantial gaps and whilst it is also a substance which can easily leak into groundwater and is suspected of interfering with human reproduction. No active substance should be approved for safe use without the essential data which proves its safety. The European Commission must request and assess the relevant missing information before deciding to renew the authorisation. The European Ombudsman earlier this year called on the Commission to severely restrict the use of this process known as the confirmatory data procedure. The Commission however has ignored this recommendation and infringed the precautionary principle by proposing the approval of bentazone. For these reasons, I voted against its reauthorisation and called on the Commission to withdraw its proposal and submit a new one.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: written. - Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No. 2016/549 of April 8, 2016, which modifies Implementing Regulation (EU) No. 540/201, extended the approval period for the active substance bentazone until June 30, 2017. In turn, the European Commission has proposed the extension of the bentazone until January 31, 2032, in accordance with Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009 on the marketing of phytosanitary products. For my part, I voted in favor of a 7.5-year extension and against the abolition of the use of the active substance. I understand that bentazone acts as a selective post-emergent herbicide against broadleaf weeds in a wide range of crops, which allows weed control and is a fundamental tool for the management of various crops in Spain, such as rice. . The suppression of the use of bentazone reduces the phytosanitary tools of farmers, worsening their competitive capacity.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this resolution because it calls on the Commission to withdraw its draft implementing regulation and submit a new draft to the committee. This implementing Regulation was submitted for the renewal of the authorization of the active substance benzathonate. The active substance bentazone acts as a selective herbicide against already sprouted broadleaf weeds, suitable for many crops and commonly used in agriculture. Due to its intrinsic properties, the active substance bentazone has a high potential for direct run-off into groundwater. According to the UK Environment Agency, the active substance bentazone is the most commonly approved pesticide in groundwater in the UK, which can also be detected on the water surface and is in a similar situation across Europe. After considering the comments received in the context of the extension assessment report, it was decided that additional information should be requested from the applicants. Parliament also noted that the consumer risk assessment had not been completed, as the proposed sediment definitions for the assessment of risks to plants and effects on livestock were considered inconclusive due to identified data gaps.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: in writing.- I do not agree with the objection and I did not support it either, as the active substance betazone, which acts as a selective herbicide for the control of leaf weeds in a wide range of crops after emergence, is often used in agriculture.As such, it is important for efficient farming and alleviates many problems for the farmer, as well as providing him with a higher yield.Also, according to current scientific and technical knowledge, some conditions and restrictions in its use are included in order to limit possible negative effects.Without the right alternative, it is very irresponsible for European agriculture to withdraw a substance from use too quickly and recklessly.Such moves are not made overnight, but all possible consequences for various stakeholders are thoroughly examined.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: in writing. ‒ I support this objection. The Commission should take into account all necessary data confirming safety of a given substance before issuing the authorisations. The approval period should be proportionate to the possible risks inherent in the use of such substances. The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle in the authorisation process of plant protection products.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against the regulation renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone because it contained too many criticisms to the placing of these plant protection products on the market despite all reassurances provided by the Commission’s studies. Indeed, I trust the work of the Commission’s experts on that topic, and I think the assessment they gave on the representative uses of the active substance bentazone is sufficient to conclude that those products do not have harmful effects on human or animal health.

name: Renata BRIANO
text: in writing.- Benzatone is a substance that acts as a selective post-emergence herbicide against broadleaf weeds in a wide variety of crops and is commonly used in agriculture.However, it has a high potential for direct leaching into groundwater (groundwater, streams, springs) and is found in very significant quantities in numerous surface water basins throughout Europe.The analyzes and studies on its actual or presumed dangerousness are not yet complete and, so far, do not allow to exclude it in toto.For this reason, and in compliance with the precautionary principle, we European parliamentarians ask the Commission to withdraw its draft regulation of benzatone, to wait for new data and to redefine a new project that focuses on protecting the health of citizens andwater and agricultural land safety.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: in writing.- Bentazon is a pesticide commonly used in the cultivation of peas, beans and potatoes.It turns out that many doubts persist as to the harmfulness of this substance to humans and the environment due to the multiple cases of groundwater contamination with bentazon.It is in this context that this report objects to the renewal of this active substance.This objection emphasizes that further assessments and analyzes remain essential before granting authorization for its renewal.We support this objection because of the precautionary principle that we must apply in the interests of our citizens and of the environment.We therefore call on the Commission to carry out the additional assessments necessary for the renewal of its authorization.So I voted for this text.

name: Cristian-Silviu BUŞOI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted against the motion for resolution on the draft Commission implementing regulation renewing approval of the active substance bentazone because bentazone is controlling volunteers of herbicide-tolerant crops and is safe when used appropriately. Bentazone is important for European farmers, being one of few ingredients which controls broad-leaf weeds in post-emergence of those crops. The active ingredient has a different mode of action which make it a key tool in resistance management in controlling difficult weeds like Ambrosia, Datura, Matricaria etc. Furthermore, bentazone has not been identified as an endocrine disruptor under the current interim criteria. Moreover, this motion neglects the significant impact such measures can have on European farmers, regarding their productivity, competitiveness, and sustainability.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing.- Today I voted in favor of the motion for a resolution on the renewal by the Commission of the authorization of bentazone.Figures from the UK Environment Agency reveal an important presence of this pesticide in UK groundwater due to its intrinsic properties.At present, adequate and sufficient information is not available, which can verify the actual absence of harmful effects on human and animal health and disastrous environmental impact.The Commission's renewal decision conflicts with its own request for more scientific information confirming the safety of the active substance.On the basis of this, the objection calls for the withdrawal of the implementation plan and the formulation of a new one based on further available data.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ Today UKIP voted against the non-legislative resolution on renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone. We believe it is important to assess missing safety information on the use of this substance. However, we would like this issue to be decided by national Parliaments

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: in writing.- The motion for a resolution on the objection to the renewal of the approval of the active substance bentazone is a sensible proposal for a review of the data which led to the approval of this substance.As this is an effort to protect the health of European citizens, I voted in favor.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. - By virtue of the studies recently emerged, particularly in the United Kingdom, regarding bentazone, I can only vote against the renewal of the expiring authorization on 30 June 2017. It is, in fact, a selective post-emergence herbicide against weeds broadleaf used in a wide variety of crops and is commonly employed in agriculture. It has a high potential for direct leaching into groundwater due to its inherent properties. It is not surprising, therefore, that it is the pesticide most detected in underground aquifers. I believe that the safety of bentazone needs confirmation and investigation, recalling how a peer-view of the European Food Safety Authority favors the classification of the herbicide among toxic substances for reproduction. The European Parliament asks the Commission to assess the missing information before opting for a renewal of the authorization.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ I did not support the motion for resolution on the objection pursuant to Rule 106: Renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone, as its safety has yet to be confirmed.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing.- I voted against the measure in question as I believe that the side effects of bentazone as an active substance have not yet been sufficiently tested.In my opinion, it is necessary to investigate this matter further by carrying out all the necessary further checks, including a complete data collection, before taking decisions on this matter.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I agree that the Commission is exceeding the implementing powers provided for in Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 on the use of the active substance bentazone. I support the precautionary stand by the rapporteur when stating that it is insufficient to conclude that, for at least one of the representative uses, a plant protection product containing the active substance bentazone may be expected not to have any harmful effect on human or animal health or on groundwater or any unacceptable influence on the environment. The reasoning is based on the precautionary principle, as set out in Article 191 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union and on that basis I agree with the call on the Commission to give priority to requesting and assessing any relevant missing information before taking a decision on approval.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: written.- I voted in favor of this objection, because I am against the renewal of the active substance bentazone, one of the pesticides most frequently found in underground and deep waters, since there is no scientific data to show that it is aSafe substance, neither for human and animal health nor for the environment.Therefore, the Commission proposal goes against the precautionary principle and ignores the Ombudsman's proposals to improve the Commission's pesticide approval system (restricting the practice of approving a substance while simultaneously requesting data that is expected toconfirm your security), so I voted in favor of the objection.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing.- The draft Commission implementing regulation renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone relating to the placing on the market of plant protection products, provides, on the basis of a scientific assessment conducted by the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA),authorization of the bentazone until January 31, 2032, i.e. for the maximum period allowed.However, the consumer risk assessment has not yet been finalized as the proposed residue definitions for risk assessment in plants and for application to animals are considered provisional due to gaps identified in the data.Therefore, I have decided to vote in favor of this objection, as the Commission's decision to approve an active substance would allow the active substance to be placed on the market before all the necessary data have been obtained to substantiate this decision.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: in writing.- I voted against the vote against the implementing act renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone.I believe that active substances, due to their hazardous nature, should be subject to special control.Incorrect use of these compounds can lead to harmful effects on both humans and the environment.The renewal of the approval of a substance is necessary to determine the specific use of plant protection products.The use of this chemical compound in many agricultural products must contain appropriate warnings about its specificity and effects.It is unacceptable that such substances should remain unattended and be freely used in the production of plant protection products.I therefore voted against.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst acknowledging that Bentazone is a post-emergent herbicide used against broadleaved weeds, commonly used for crops in agriculture, and that it can leach under conditions of extreme rainfall due to its high mobility, it is also worth looking at its impacts on the environment and citizens’ health, such as the high potential for direct leaching to groundwater due to its inherent properties, before reauthorising this substance for the maximum 15 years. I voted in favour of the objection because we want to have proper data in hand before actually having this substance reauthorised. It is not a question of banning the substance but a question of making sure this substance doesn’t have negative health implications.

name: Daniel DALTON
text: in writing. ‒ I firmly oppose this resolution which is factually incorrect. By seeking to object to renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone, Parliament is pandering to half-truths and hearsay over scientific assessment. I also object to the fact that the Ombudsman was misquoted in the resolution, and to the resolution’s conclusion that the Commission has breached the provisions of the regulation; this is simply incorrect.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: in writing. - This motion for a resolution aims to issue a negative opinion on the renewal of the authorization of bentazon, an active substance used in the manufacture of pesticides used in agriculture. As part of the mandate granted by the European Parliament and the Council, the Commission proposed the renewal until 2032, the standard legal duration. In light of current scientific and technical knowledge, I support the renewal proposal, but call for further toxicological analyzes. I regret that the rapporteur has not taken into consideration the proposals of the PPE Group aimed at providing more guarantees regarding the use of bentazon products. We had indeed proposed to reduce the re-authorization period, to restrict the use of products to professionals and to prohibit its use in sensitive areas, such as parks and public gardens. Considering, on the one hand, that the Commission has respected its mandate by following the positive scientific opinion of the European Food Safety Authority and, on the other hand, that this proposal does not take into account the positions defended at the EPP , I voted against.

name: Angélique DELAHAYE
text: in writing. - Some MEPs have objected to the renewal of the authorization of bentazon, an active ingredient in a plant protection product which has a herbicidal effect. This substance, already used in certain Member States such as France, is essential for combating poisonous plants. The sector does not yet know of any alternative solutions to this substance, which makes bentazon essential. The PPE Group proposed several amendments in order to find a balanced position on this issue. In particular, we have proposed strengthening the supervision of its use for professionals and prohibiting it for non-professionals. Scientific studies show that bentazon is safe when used properly. We also proposed to ban this substance in areas used by the general public or to support research and innovation in order to find alternative solutions. Finally, we wanted a renewal not for 15 years as proposed by the Commission, but only for 7.5 years. These solutions were not accepted, however, and we were unable to find an acceptable compromise on the renewal of this substance, which I regret, so I voted against this objection.

name: Mark DEMESMAEKER
text: written. - The N-VA delegation did not support the objection to the renewed approval of the active substance bentazone, mainly for the following two reasons: the European Commission did not exceed its mandate in its decision to renew its approval. The N-VA strongly believes in evidence-based and scientifically based policy. Both the European Food Safety Agency (EFSA) and the rapporteur Member State, the Netherlands, came to the conclusion that bentazone is safe when used correctly. All this does not alter the fact that the N-VA is emphatically in favor of integrated pest management and advocates the sustainable use of pesticides and non-chemical alternatives. The N-VA has therefore supported amendments to that effect. In Flanders, a pesticide ban for public authorities has been in force since January 2015 under the motto without is healthier. Pesticides can only be used under specific conditions. Private individuals are also encouraged to avoid pesticides.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the resolution calling for the European authorization for the herbicide bentazon, which expires on June 30, 2017, not to be renewed until its safety has been confirmed.It appears that bentazon can easily reach groundwater and could be toxic to human reproduction.I further note that the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) has proposed that the active substance bentazon be classified as a category 2 reproductive toxicant. Also, as long as the risk assessment for consumers n'will not have been finalized and data will be missing, in particular with regard to the potential exposure of groundwater, I plead for the strict application of the precautionary principle.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: in writing.- I voted for this report.With this report, the Commissioners ask the Commission to carry out the necessary additional analyzes before renewing the authorization of the active substance bentazon.Indeed, the Commission intended to use the confirmatory data procedure, which contradicts the precautionary principle.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: in writing. - We are voting in favor of the motion for a resolution of the Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety on the draft Commission Implementing Regulation renewing the authorization of the active substance bentazone, pursuant to Regulation (EC) No. Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market and amending the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 1107/2009 540/2011 of the Commission, because the information submitted to that committee must be confirmatory in terms of its effects on human, animal, groundwater or any other unacceptable effects on the environment.

name: Jill EVANS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report. I believe the evidence shows that this policy is the correct one. We are very aware of the dangers of  chemicals in our environment in Wales.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: in writing.- Vote in favor: the objection rightly points out that many evaluations are still necessary for the granting of the authorization: this concerns, in particular, evaluations on the risk for the consumer and the possibility of infiltration of groundwaterand surface.In view of the importance of this information, the so-called “confirmation data” procedure goes against the precautionary principle and cannot be the basis for granting an authorization for a period of fifteen years (the maximum period)..

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - According to the term established in Reg.1141 / 2010, there was a request for renewal of the active substance already authorized bentazone, since its authorization initially expired on 6/30/2016. This resolution opposes the European Commission's draft implementing measure which approves the renewal of the substance for another fifteen years. There are well-founded concerns about the effects of this active substance on the environment, which justify deepening and improving the knowledge available, with a view to adopting the measures that prove necessary in terms of safeguarding the environment and public health. It is important to keep in mind the high dependence of this substance in certain cultures, such as rice, as well as the fact that currently there are no restrictions on the use of bentazone, whereas in the past the substance was authorized only for use as a herbicide. Immediately, and in view of the problem of the lack of alternatives invoked by several producers, it would be important to consider the mandatory reduction of application doses and the concentration of this active substance, considering, at the same time, the role of adjuvants, the necessary inhibition of harmful side actions and, thus, the facilitation of decomposition.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the objection.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing - The present proposal envisages the authorization of bentazone for a period of 15 years, namely until 31.1.2032.Several studies indicate that bentazone is harmful to the environment.The assessment based on the representative use of the active substance bentazone is insufficient to conclude that, in at least one typical use, a plant protection product containing the active substance bentazone can be expected not to have harmful effects on human or animal health or on groundwater.water or an unacceptable effect on the environment.The European Commission should focus on verifying the information and thoroughly assessing it before taking an approval decision.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the objection because I believe it is necessary for the Commission to receive any missing information on bentazone before taking a decision on the approval for the renewal of the authorization.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: in writing. - I am voting in favor of the motion for a resolution of the Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety on the draft implementing regulation of the Commission renewing the authorization of the active substance bentazone pursuant to Regulation (EC) No. Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the placing of plant protection products on the market, and amending the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 1107/2009 540/2011 of the Commission, as the information submitted to this committee must be of a confirmatory nature as regards the effects on human, animal, groundwater or any other unacceptable effects on the environment.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. – The objection does not focus on the characterisation of the substance and whether bentazone itself should be banned or re-authorised, but it is based on the authorisation process itself as the Commission (once again) proposes to re-authorise an active substance for the maximum period possible (15 years) while at the same requesting confirmatory data to evaluate its safety. This is against the EU Ombudsman’s ruling from February 2016 (Case: 12/2013/MDC), against the provisions in the Regulation 2009/1107 and against any logic of evaluating safety of pesticides.  The severity of this objection might be not as high compared to the objection on active substance glyphosate but the principle of respecting the existing law is crucial. Otherwise we would find ourselves in a position where approved substances in the EU are, in some instances, unsafe and/or not in accordance with relevant legislation. The Commission should take into account all necessary data confirming safety of a given substance before issuing the authorisations. The approval period should be proportionate to the possible risks inherent in the use of such substances. The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle in the authorisation process of plant protection products.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: written.- I voted against the objection considering that with all the information available, the use of the active substance bentazone does not represent a risk to the health of European citizens or have an impact on the environment.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the resolution on the draft Commission implementing regulation renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone under Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the placing on the market of plant protection products, and amending the annex to the Implementing Regulation (EU) no. 540/2011 of the Commission, because I believe that all the necessary information is still lacking to endorse with total certainty the renewal of the approval of the bentazone granted by the Commission. The precautionary principle contained in regulation 1187/2009 is in fact for me a cardinal principle of EU environmental policy: the protection of plants and the marketing of plant protection products must therefore comply with this principle. The Commission's choice to grant renewal of approval through the unique confirmation data procedure is in violation of this principle and Parliament cannot accept that a long-term authorization be granted for a product in the absence of a risk assessment for consumers, mammals and endocrine interference profiles. I therefore ask the Commission to withdraw the proposed measure and EFSA to make all necessary investigations.

name: Arne GERICKE
text: written.- I voted against the "Objection under Article 106 of the Rules of Procedure: Extension of the approval of the active substance bentazone", as I support the position of the EU Commission and the ban on this dangerous substance.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: written.- We must not burden agriculture with further overregulation if this does not result in any benefit for health or the environment.I have therefore spoken out against a ban on bentazone.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against the non-legislative resolution on renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone. I believe it is important to assess missing safety information on the use of this substance. However, I would like this issue to be decided by national parliaments.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the objection given the Commission should take into account all necessary data confirming safety of a given substance before issuing the authorisations. The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle in the authorisation process of plant protection products.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: written.- I vote in favor of the objection in line with the precautionary principle to avoid the renewal of the bentazone.In the absence of data demonstrating the safety of a chemical substance, I understand that its use should not be authorized.The European Commission exceeds its enforcement powers provided for in Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009.The planned reauthorization of bentazone for 15 years is not compatible with the purpose of Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009, which is to ensure a high level of protection for both human and animal health and the environment.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this objection because the Commission should take into account all necessary data confirming safety of a given substance before issuing the authorisations. The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle in the authorisation process of plant protection products.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: in writing.The WHO in 1991 reported that bentazone had relatively low acute toxicity to rats, guinea pigs and rabbits and the WHO classified it as a slightly dangerous substance.There are also studies that show that it is toxic to living organisms and that, if found in a high content of drinking water, it is also very toxic.That is why we voted against the motion for a resolution.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ The objection focused exclusively on procedural aspects of this pesticide authorisation. For one, certain data had still been requested from the applicant in the so-called ‘confirmatory data procedure’, a practice which had been heavily criticised by the European Ombudsman in a Decision from February 2016. On top of that, the Commission granted the authorisation for a full 15 years despite this lack of data on human and animal toxicity as well as ecotoxicity, as stated in the EFSA review. The original authorisation for bentazone was granted in August 2001 and expired at the end of 2015. However, COM Implementing Regulation (EU) 2016/549 extended the expiry date for bentazone by 1.5 years until 30 June 2017 in order to allow the renewal process to be completed before the expiry of the approval. The current draft Implementing Regulation proposes to renew the authorisation of bentazone until January 2032. The European Parliament has no formal right of veto on this Implementing Regulation but can give its opinion prior to the vote by the Member States. The draft was presented to the Standing Committee on Phytopharmaceuticals for opinion in the meeting of 7/8 October.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour since I have no objections.

name: Anja HAZEKAMP
text: written.- The European Commission wants to extend the approval for the widely used herbicide bentazone by no less than 15 years, while bentazone is certainly not an unspoken poison.There are indications that bentazone pollutes groundwater and that it has a hormone-disrupting effect.As long as there is no conclusive evidence that the use of bentazone is safe for humans, the environment and animals, the precautionary principle should apply.Then it is not possible for the European Commission to hand out approvals and extensions without worries.The Party for the Animals is of the opinion that there should be no renewal of the approval for the active substance bentazone.That is why I voted against this extension.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of this objection to the use of the substance bentazone, which expires on 30 June 2017, but whose draft measure approves the renewal of the authorization of the substance for another 15 years (until 31 January 2032).The Commission must take into account all necessary data confirming the safety of the substance before issuing authorizations.The approval period must be proportionate to the possible risks inherent in the use of such substances.The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle in the product authorization process.

name: Peter JAHR
text: written.- Political decisions should always be based on a scientific basis, taking social needs into account.Today's decision by the European Parliament on bentazone does not live up to this claim.With the amendments tabled by the EPP Group, we had, in my opinion, drawn up a balanced text, which, however, did not find a majority in plenary.However, I welcome the call on the Commission to provide research and innovation and a sustainable and cost-effective alternative in the field of plant protection.Our farmers depend on it precisely to ensure the food security and competitiveness of European agriculture.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: written.- I voted in favor of the European Parliament resolution on the draft Commission implementing regulation extending the authorization of the active substance bentazone in accordance with Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006.Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the placing of plant protection products on the market and amending the Annex to Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) no.540/2011 because it calls on the Commission to withdraw the draft implementing decision.It is extremely important to apply the precautionary principle in cases where there is a danger to human health and the environment.In the present case, various circumstances indicate that caution should be exercised so as not to authorize an active substance which may endanger public health or the environment, and I therefore support this objection.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: in writing.- Given the potentially dangerous nature of bentazon, I support the objection aimed at carrying out additional studies, necessary for the renewal of the authorization of this product.I voted for.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: in writing.- I voted against the objection to the renewal of the authorization of the active substance bentazon.The European Food Safety Authority has concluded that the active substance in bentazon is safe when used appropriately.The sector faces a complex situation given the lack of a substitute solution.I supported the compromises stressing the importance of research and innovation to find alternative solutions and limit its use in places frequented by the public (playgrounds, public gardens, parks) in the name of the precautionary principle.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: in writing.- I voted against this objection, which was intended to prevent the renewal of the herbicide bentazon.This substance is used in France on three vegetables intended for industry (canned peas, beans in pods and flageolet beans).It is essential to fight against poisonous plants.In addition, both the responsible national agency and the European agency in charge of these cases (the European Food Safety Authority - EFSA), have come to the conclusion that the active substance bentazone is safe when used.appropriately.There is therefore no reason to prevent its renewal.The EPP has also tabled amendments to regulate its use and limit the renewal of its authorization.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: written.- I am voting in favor of the objection to approval of bentazone.This active ingredient is a herbicide against broad-leaved plants and is commonly used in agriculture, where there is a high risk of groundwater pollution.The present objection raised by this resolution rightly states that an authorization procedure - especially if the authorization is to be extended to the maximum period - takes into account the precautionary principle and calls on the Commission to provide missing information before it makes a decision on the authorization.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the objection given the Commission should take into account all necessary data confirming safety of a given substance before issuing the authorisations.

name: Kateřina KONEČNÁ
text: in writing. - On 23 November 2016, we voted in the plenary session of the European Parliament in Strasbourg on the objection to the renewal of the approval of the active substance bentazone. This is one of the many fights that my colleagues and I have fought with the European Commission and its established practice to renew the authorization of the use of potentially dangerous substances without a proper and openly consulted scientific assessment of harmfulness by the professional public. This time, the European Commission presented a proposal to renew the authorization of the substance for another 15 years (7 was enough for glyphosate), despite the UK Environment Agency detecting the normal presence of this pesticide in surface and groundwater and bentazone. No relevant studies on its carcinogenicity and effects on the human endocrine system have been performed. At the same time, a significant effect on the endocrine system of mammals has already been demonstrated with this substance, for example in laboratory rats. In the absence of clear data that this substance is not harmful to health, I followed the precautionary principle and supported this objection. So I voted against authorizing bentazone.

name: Elisabeth KÖSTINGER
text: written.- I abstained from voting on the extension of the approval of bentazone: Due to sufficient substitutes in agricultural use in Austria, approval in my Member State is not absolutely necessary.In view of the fact that the application of the active substance may be exceeded, the decision of the member state should be accepted in the interests of sovereignty.Nonetheless, I am aware of the need for agricultural application in other Member States.

name: Stelios KOULOGLOU
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour to prohibit the renewal of bentazone authorisation since there is not enough evidence to conclude that its use will not harm human and animal health and the environment.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: in writing.- Bentazon is a pesticide whose harmfulness to humans and the environment is still debated.The UK Environment Agency has found frequent cases of bentazon contamination of water, ground and surface, as pesticides tend to leach into soils.This objection to the re-authorization of the active substance bentazon rightly underlines that the tests and studies are far from unanimous on the absence of dangers and that is why I voted in favor of it.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: written.- I voted in favor of this objection, because I am against the renewal of the active substance bentazone, one of the pesticides most frequently found in underground and deep waters, since there is no scientific data to show that it is aSafe substance, neither for human and animal health nor for the environment.Therefore, the Commission proposal goes against the precautionary principle and ignores the Ombudsman's proposals to improve the Commission's pesticide approval system (restricting the practice of approving a substance while simultaneously requesting data that is expected toconfirm your security), so I voted in favor of the objection.

name: Mairead McGUINNESS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this resolution as it goes against the Commission proposal of renewing the authorisation of bentazone.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: written.- The active substance bentazone acts as a selective herbicide that is applied after emergence against broadleaf weeds in various crops and is often used in agriculture.According to the United Kingdom Environment Agency, the active substance bentazone is an approved pesticide that is most commonly found in UK groundwater and is also present in surface waters.The situation is similar in the whole of Europe.Based on the assessment of representative uses of the active substance bentazone, it cannot be concluded that a plant protection product containing the active substance bentazone can be expected to have no adverse effects on human or animal health or groundwater, or any unacceptable effects on the environment.supported this resolution.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing - I support the EP's request to the Commission to adhere strictly to the precautionary principle when authorizing the use of bentazone.This substance is commonly used in agriculture and penetrates groundwater and surface water throughout Europe.In case of doubt about the effects of substances on public health and the environment, the Commission cannot propose the approval of substances without proper investigation.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the motion for a resolution in which the European Parliament calls on the Commission to withdraw its implementing rules.

name: Georg MAYER
text: written.- The great danger that the use of this herbicide poses for the groundwater must be resolutely countered.The present resolution condemns the Commission's proposal to extend the use of bentazone until 2032.I fully agree with this.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the motion for a resolution.I agree with the experts that the Commission did not take all the circumstances into account and did not follow the precautionary principle when renewing the approval of the active substance bentazone.I support the provisions of the resolution, which call on the Commission to gather and evaluate the missing information before taking a decision.For these reasons, the European Parliament asks the Commission to withdraw its draft implementing regulation and submit a new draft to the committee.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: in writing.- The active substance bentazon is a selective post-emergence herbicide against broadleaf weeds.It is marketed by the BASF toxic group and is commonly used in agriculture.It is also frequently found in groundwater or surface water, causing pollution of drinking water reserves.The report submitted to us opposes the renewal of the authorization of this product proposed by the European Commission.Indeed, it appears that the Commission was considering renewing this substance without having first collected data confirming its safety.Given its irresponsibility in this area, I am opposed to any future decision-making by the Commission on plant protection products.I vote for this text

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: in writing. - Bentazon is a pesticide commonly used in agriculture. Doubts remain as to its harmfulness to humans and the environment, despite several reassuring studies. This contamination from seepage depends, in part, on the type of soil and its porosity and is hampered by the rapid photodegradation of this substance. However, the UK Environment Agency has found frequent cases of bentazon contamination of groundwater and even surface water. In addition, doubts remain as to the dangerousness of bentazon for human health, although, according to the conclusions of several scientific studies emanating in particular from the World Health Organization, this would be conditioned by the absorption of very strong doses. The objection points out that many assessments are still necessary for the granting of the authorization: these include, in particular, assessments on the risk to the consumer and the possibility of infiltration of ground (and surface) water. In view of the importance of this information, the so-called "confirmation data" procedure goes against the precautionary principle, and cannot be the basis for granting an authorization for a period of fifteen years. I therefore support the objection calling on the Commission to seek evaluations.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing.- The active substance bentazone acts as a post-emergence selective herbicide against broadleaf weeds in a wide range of crops, and is commonly used in agriculture.The active substance bentazone, due to its intrinsic properties, has a high leaching potential for groundwater.In view of the above and the terms in which the present proposal was presented, I voted against.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ It is evident that there is insufficient information on the potential harmful effect on human or animal health amongst others of plant protection products containing the active substance bentazone. I believe that the Commission should request and assess any relevant missing information before a decision for approval is taken. I have therefore voted in favour of the objection for the renewal of the approval of the active substance bentazone.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: written.- With this resolution we ask the Commission not to take premature decisions, but to base an approval for the extension of the use of the active ingredient bentazone in plant protection products on all the necessary information needed to make that decision.The license for the use of bentazone will expire on 30 June 2017. This means that the Commission has until then to take a decision on the basis of a complete dossier, including the data on the impact of bentazone on humans, animals and the environment.to take.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: in writing - The active substance bentazone acts as a selective herbicide against broadleaf weeds and is commonly used in agriculture. However, due to its essential properties, bentazone has a high potential to penetrate groundwater, as confirmed by data from the UK Environment Agency, which show that bentazone is the most frequently detected approved pesticide in groundwater in the United Kingdom and is also found in surface waters; the situation is similar across Europe. The precautionary principle to be applied in accordance with Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009, requires the Commission not to approve active substances in cases where public health or the environment may be endangered. There is insufficient information on the safety of bentazone, an assessment based on the representative use of bentazone is not sufficient to conclude that a plant protection product containing bentazone as an active substance will not have harmful effects on human, animal, groundwater or the environment. The Commission therefore goes beyond the implementing powers provided for in the Regulation. I therefore agree with the motion for a resolution in which Parliament calls on the Commission to withdraw its proposal for an implementing regulation and to submit a new proposal to the committee.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the report because I agree that the Commission should take into account all necessary data confirming safety of a given substance before issuing the authorisations. The approval period should be proportionate to the possible risks inherent in the use of such substances. The precautionary principle should be the guiding principle in the authorisation process of plant protection products.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: in writing. - The Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety has tabled a motion for a resolution extending the approval of the active substance bentazone under Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market and amending the Annex to Implementing Regulation (EU) No 540/2011. draft implementing regulation. The draft resolution proposes that the draft Commission Implementing Regulation goes beyond the implementing powers provided for in Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 and that the Commission has infringed Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009 by applying the confirmatory information procedure to the active substance bentazone; the precautionary principle enshrined in Article 191 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union. The draft proposes that Parliament call on the Commission to request and assess the relevant missing information before deciding on its approval, and to ask it to withdraw its draft implementing regulation and submit a new draft. I voted in favor of the proposal.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: in writing. - Bentazon is a commonly used pesticide, especially for peas, beans and potatoes. Doubts remain about its harmfulness to humans and the environment, despite several encouraging studies. The objection rightly points out that many assessments are still necessary for the granting of the authorization: these include, in particular, assessments of the risk to the consumer and the possibility of infiltration of ground and surface water. In view of the importance of this information, the so-called “confirmation data” procedure goes against the precautionary principle, and cannot be the basis for granting an authorization for a period of fifteen years (the maximum period ). For all these reasons, the ENF group supports the objection calling on the Commission to carry out the additional assessments necessary for the renewal of the authorization of bentazone, before proceeding with it.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: in writing.- This objection calling on the Commission to carry out the additional assessments necessary for the renewal of the authorization of bentazon, before proceeding with this, seems to me to be well founded.I'm voting for.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: in writing.- I voted against this objection to the bentazon.This substance, which is one of the only effective ones, is used on certain vegetables to control poisonous plants such as datura, nightshades and groundsel.This substance has also been considered safe by the European Food Safety Authority.The political groups which have lodged this objection serve their dogmatic positions more than the interests of farmers and more broadly of European citizens.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ Bentazone is used as a herbicide against broadleaved weeds in a broad range of crops in agriculture. I have voted for this motion for a resolution that requests the Commission to assess and complete all relevant information before taking a decision regarding the approval of use for this substance.

name: Dan NICA
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of the European Parliament resolution calling on the Commission to withdraw its draft regulation renewing its approval of the active substance bentazone and to submit a new draft.The active substance bentazone is the most commonly detected authorized pesticide in water because it has a high potential for direct infiltration into groundwater.We call on the Commission and the Member States to fund research and innovation in the field of sustainable and cost-effective alternative solutions for pest control products, in order to ensure a high level of protection of human and animal health and the environment.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report as I believe that more information needs to be submitted before a final decision can be made.The active ingredient is a broad-leaved herbicide and is commonly used in agriculture.

name: Urmas PAET
text: in writing.- I supported.It has not yet been established whether bentazone is harmless to humans, so its authorization should not be renewed until it has been clarified.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: in writing. - I support the resolution that has been tabled. Careful and careful choice of plant protection products is necessary to avoid risks to human health and the environment from pesticides, contamination of water bodies, groundwater and soil. I believe that the authorization of the active substance benzathone should not be renewed in view of the negative effects of this substance on the environment and human health. It should be noted that the Commission's decision to approve an active substance, while requesting data to confirm its safety, will allow it to be placed on the market before the Commission receives all the data needed to substantiate this decision. Such actions may adversely affect human or animal health, the environment and groundwater. Against this background, I believe that the Commission should withdraw its draft implementing regulation and submit a new draft to the committee. In addition, the Commission must request and assess the missing information before taking a decision on approval.

name: Gilles PARGNEAUX
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this resolution, which recommends not renewing the authorization of the herbicide bentazone.Bentazon can easily reach groundwater and could be toxic to human reproduction.The European Commission must take into account all the necessary data confirming the safety of a given substance before issuing authorizations, especially as the peer review of the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) has proposed that thebentazon active substance is classified as a category 2 reproductive toxicant.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing.- I voted against my colleagues' proposal because I believe that the active substance of bentazone is used, with excellent results, as a tool aimed at eradicating broadleaf weeds, and also represents, in the light of the data developed by the Environment Agencyof the United Kingdom, the substance most detected in groundwater and surface water.The European Union, with regulation no.1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the placing on the market of plant protection products and amending the annex to the Implementing Regulation (EU) no.540/2011 of the Commission, extends the use of this substance until 2032, imposing, however, compliance with the conditions and restrictions due to the dangerous nature of the active substance of bentazone.Therefore I voted negative.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: written. - I did not support the European Parliament's objection under Rule 106 of the Rules of Procedure concerning the extension of the authorization of the active substance bentazone. The side effects of bentazone as an active substance have not yet been sufficiently investigated, and I therefore supported the amendments of the European People's Advocates' Club, which called for an extension of the approval for a shorter period than proposed, with the necessary testing. Namely, bentazone is the active substance of several different herbicides used in agriculture to protect crops such as corn, peas, beans ... In terms of toxicity to target species and quality, the active substance is recognized as a potential mutagen, but not a carcinogen, and is without negatively affecting pollinators like bees. In some Member States, due to intensive use, increased concentrations in watercourses have been reported after application and precipitation, but with proper and professional application, the negative effects can be mitigated. In Croatia, this active substance is used on 37,000 hectares of agricultural land, and Croatian farmers believe that at the moment there is no adequate substitute that would replace bentazone equally well. Given that the possibility of sustainable conventional agriculture without the use of herbicides is not in sight in the near future and for all other reasons stated here, I did not support this objection.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: in writing. - Bentazon is a commonly used pesticide, especially for peas, beans and potatoes. Doubts remain about its harmfulness to humans and the environment, despite several encouraging studies. The objection rightly points out that many assessments are still necessary for the granting of the authorization: these include, in particular, assessments of the risk to the consumer and the possibility of infiltration of ground and surface water. In view of the importance of this information, the so-called “confirmation data” procedure goes against the precautionary principle, and cannot be the basis for granting an authorization for a period of fifteen years (the maximum period ). For all these reasons, I support the objection calling on the Commission to initiate the additional assessments necessary for the renewal of the authorization of bentazon, before proceeding with this.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: written. - The active substance bentazone acts as a selective herbicide used in agriculture and due to its inherent properties there is a great possibility of direct leaching into groundwater, as well as its presence in surface waters, which is confirmed by data from environmental agencies. Taking into account current scientific and technical knowledge, the Draft Implementing Regulation sets out certain conditions and restrictions, in particular the requirement to provide additional confirmatory information. After considering the comments received on the report, it was concluded that additional information should be requested from the applicants. The consumer risk assessment has not been completed because the proposed residue definitions for risk assessment in plants and for use in animals have been considered provisional due to insufficient data.
